name: Hyatt Regency Phoenix

reviews.text: Stayed here plenty of times (too many to remember) with conventions just down the street, this time it was a smaller convention in the hotel. The restaurants are great in the hotel and surrounding area and the hotel bar "Networks" is always a great meeting place and the staff there is always fast and friendly. The front desk is very friendly and helpful with anything I have ever needed. The doormen are always in the know of anything going on in town and where to find the best local foods and entertainment. The rooms are always clean and spotless and I've never had a bad experience here during any of my stays. Beds are comfortable and the shower has plenty of pressure which is always an important feature!
reviews.title: For a Convention Stay it is Perfect !

reviews.text: I have read some reviews that the decor is considered dated in the lobby but I don't have that opinion of it. If it is dated as they are claiming, then in a few years it will be considered retro. If you have to stay in the area for a convention then this is the place to stay....anything comparable as far as hotel star ratings in the surrounding area will be much more expensive and anything less expensive farther out will cost you a taxi ride to and from and will add up to no savings in the end or maybe even more expensive. This is the best place to stay for a convention or even if visiting the downtown area for a get-away! You will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: One of the best!

reviews.text: I have stayed in more than a few hotels in Downtown Phoenix, and this is one of the best. The service is wonderful, the food is excellent and for sure, I will stay there again! Their breakfast buffet is very good, and the servers in the restaurant are very friendly. The light rail station is a block away and it is perfect to go to local attractions, like the Art Museum and the Heard Museum.
reviews.title: Great stay at a great price

reviews.text: Easy check in. Nice clean room and facilities. Pool was shallow but enjoyable. Gym was well equipped. Easy access to restaurants. Grill located in lobby had very good food. Only complaints are the a/c barely kept the room cool and the bed was not very comfortable. Would return here.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel and staff

reviews.text: As a government meeting planner, I must watch cost, especially now with the budget cuts and sequestration. When I contacted this hotel as a potential place to house the meetings I was planning, the experience was top-notch right from the start. My sales manager made my job a whole lot easier, then my banquets manager picked up where the sales manager left off. It was a pleasant experience from start to finish. Then when I arrived at the hotel I was treated like royalty. Everybody did their best to make me and my attendees (well over 200) feel like we were 'part of the family'. No matter where I went within the hotel, the employees knew me by name and were very willing to be of service. LT was my on site contact. She was absolutely fabulous. She came by several times a day to make sure things were running smoothly. If I needed anything, she was more than willing to see that I got what I needed. The food was wonderful as well. Einsteins Cafe was right up there with Starbucks. The lodging rooms were clean and comfortable. The rest rooms by the meeting rooms were well stocked and very clean. I don't see how anyone could complain about this hotel or the staff. I guess you can't please everyone. I can't say enough good things about the Hyatt Regency Downtown Phoenix. The proximity to area restaurants within walking distance was wonderful. It was good to get out after being inside with meetings all day. The weather was hot, but not unbearable. I would definitely take another meeting back to this hotel and I would recommend this hotel to anyone for business or pleasure.
reviews.title: Decent stay with this place

reviews.text: Close to everything, great view, wonderful restaurant on the top floor. I had room 1639 at the end of the hall. Great room!!! Very quiet. Others from my conference complained about noise in their room at night. Not so from higher floors. Staff were all great. My only complaint is the pool. The pool area is lovely with nice deck chairs and lots of umbrellas. Nice for relaxing, reading. But the pool itself is terrible other than it was cool water. It needs relining in the worst way. Every time you take a step its like walking on a floating carpet. I imagine those who are unsteady on their feet could have trouble. Otherwise I will come back to this hotel for sure especially for extended business travel.
reviews.title: Would come back

reviews.text: I stayed for a little over a week and loved my stay. It is so conveniently located and staff both friendly and helpful. Got great recommendations for nightlife nearby. The Best chocolate cake ever in the restaurant off the lobby! there is an excellent gym if you want exercise and beautiful views from both rooms and the glass enclosed elevator!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: great location right in downtown. It is close to virtually everything and exceptionally nice. The reception area is modern and well decorated. The rooms are comfortable and beds are relatively comfortable. The workout room is great and the pool ok for a dip, not much else. Really can't do laps in it. The only poor thing was the selection of TV channels. pretty limited and some did not work and some in Spanish.
reviews.title: Still an excellent place to stay in Phoenix

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recommend this for the location.
reviews.title: stayed for our anniversary

reviews.text: If you find this helpful please mark it so.
reviews.title: High above Downtown Phoenix

reviews.text: We came in at 1:00 am and checked out at 8:00am so it was a short stay, but we were impressed with the hotel, we would stay there again at a better price. Paid 149.00 Auto Club discount. I'm sure it can be booked elsewhere for cheaper. Beautiful lobby would have loved to lounge for awhile but no time. Very polite staff throughout.
reviews.title: Elegant Hotel
Beware the car service scam
reviews.text: Close to ASU downtown campus , walking distance if not hot out, we were there for my son's orientation. Awesome view of Chase field and all of Phoenix. Awesome, great beds,wish we could take them home with us.

reviews.title: Beware the car service scam
reviews.text: We are usually a Hilton family, but this is our second time staying at Hyatt and we may be switching.
Only downside, parking structure is across small street and you have to take elevator down from garage and walk across street to hotel, but ok.
reviews.title: Not one of the best Hyatts
What a disappointment!
reviews.text: Starbucks just across street, oh yeah!

reviews.title: Nonrefundable deposit - beware
reviews.text: I booked a room online in January for a July stay. I wanted to cancel 3 months prior to July, but Hyatt charges $50 to cancel. They would not even let me transfer my payment to another Hyatt. No other hotel I deal with (major or minor) has this policy. Most hotels will allow cancellation outside 72 hours.
Beware of this before you book online.
reviews.title: Good location

likes.disliked: — outdated decor, hard mattresses and lack of restaurants

reviews.title: Unfortunate Changes
reviews.text: Typical Hyatt located in downtown Phoenix with great access to museums and cultural events. Towering, open lobby. Staff is very nice and accommodating. Rooms really need updating - popcorn ceilings, 1970's decor; very hard mattresses. Although it caters to conventions, it is a relatively quite hotel. Aside from the outdated decor, the other major drawback are the restaurants. There is only one main restaurant - the Compass - but it is very hard to get a reservation as it is always full. The Bar and Grill is also always full and the other restaurant (The Terrace Cafe) is only open for breakfast and lunch. There is an Einstein Bagels in the main lobby, but all the times we've stayed at the Hyatt we have had to either order room service or go next door to the Westin because the two restaurants in the Hyatt were full.

We live in the Phoenix area and planned to eat at the Hyatt before hearing the Phoenix Symphony across the street. We've done that for years. As we entered the lobby, I was surprised at how dingy the carpet and uhpholstery had become. We took the elevator to the Compass Room, a revolving restaurant on the top floor. When I said, "We'd just like to head for the bar," the host said tersely, "We don't have a bar. We have a cocktail lounge with sitdown service and a $15 minimum." Okay, there's a view and sometimes you have to pay for a view. The bar was nearly deserted. We had our wine and moved on. There was something ungracious and unsavory about the whole experience. Our plan was to move down to the Hyatt's Terrace Cafe for a light supper. On a Saturday night it was closed--already set up for breakfast. Next, we tried the sports bar off the lobby. But we were headed for the symphony and the cigarette smoke and big screens just didn't work. Three strikes and we were out of there. We won't be back.
reviews.title: Long stay, nice property, a few problems

likes.disliked: — Lack of activities/dining in downtown Phoenix. It is practically dead.

reviews.text: My first trip (ever) to downtown Phoenix brought me on business to the Hyatt Regency. A national convention was held across the street in the Phoenix Convention Center and thus the location of the Hyatt Regency was spot on perfect. The bellmen was quick to take my bags to my room after a check-in process that was fast and friendly. A Sunday night arrival meant little or no downtown traffic and I quickly got setteld in for a 4 day convention. I discovered that the bar in the lobby served great food and was an excellent place for watching sports and chatting with other conventioneers which I ended up doing all 3 nights of my stay. My room was comfortable, the bathroom was a little small but the bed was just right. I ate breakfast in the main restaurant one morning and the food was fine and the service was very good. I used the fitness center twice (very nice) and the swimming pool once (average and somewhat cramped). I would stay here again for business but probably not for a family trip or shopping. The proximity to the ball parks is excellent though and sports fans would probably like this property.
reviews.title: Well Done Hyatt!
Good meeting facilities
reviews.text: In a meeting you always enjoy having an opportunity to go outside. Having breakout rooms with a outside courtyard allowed a great opportunity to get sun Sun and experience Phoenix weather. The beds were comfy and room was clean. The food could have been upgraded. Never experienced a good meal while there the entire time.

We recently stayed here during a convention trip. We stayed here of one week. This gave us a couple days before and after the convention to see the area. The hotel was nice. there was a problem with our room keys losing its programing. This happend 4 timnes during the first two days. It happen to another couple we were traveling with as well. It was solved when maintenance reprogrammed the door lock. The concierge, James, was extremely helpful. He helped iron out many of our last minute plans to go sight seeing of were to go for dinner. Ryan the bar tender at Networks was fun and helpful as well. Al staff were pleasnat and friendly. The only real issue was that the hotel only open thier buffet brackfast once the hotel reached a certain occupancy. Well, on days that it was not open, service was slow to say the least. Extra staff would have been greatlly apprciated. The staff that were there were runnig around but just could not keep up with everything and everyone. The hotel is centrally located and has many dinning options near-by. The pool small and there is an outdoor hottub. But we always found a chase recliner each time we went. The bed was very comfortable. I have back problems but unlike many places I have stayed I had no issues. Housekeeping was attentive as well.
reviews.title: Convention trip

reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at the Hyatt Regency hotel while attending a music gathering. On check in, we were shown to a room which was nice, but not what we had asked for. We had asked for a room with direct access to the pool. So they switched us to room 310 right then and there, which is a handicap room, and did have a sliding door to the pool area.
reviews.title: Very friendly to our group
Exceeded expectations
reviews.text: This room was huge, with a large bathroom which had a shower that had no tub (for easy handicap access). Our shower did have shower curtains which reached the floor (as another reviewer complained theirs was lacking), and leakage from the shower was non-existent.

When we pulled up we were quickly greeted by a bellhop person...while it was great to be greeted we felt really rushed to quickly unload our car and have them valet park it. Check in was quick and we our room for the night was located on the 19th floor. If you are scared of heights do not stay high up, as the elevator has windows and moves very quickly. Our 2 year old was freighted! Room service was overpriced...Overall our stay was good...I really do not feel this is a good hotel with younger children. I think my husband would return if we were catching a concert/game downtown, as the location cannot be beat!
reviews.title: Great downtown location!

reviews.text: I was in Phoenix for a tradeshow at the convention center which is conveniently located right across the street from the Hyatt Regency. I'm a Platinum member of another hotel program so I normally use them. The Hyatt was so convenient that I decided to give them a try and was quite impressed. I've joined their program too now. The bellmen helped with my bags and rounding up several boxes that I had shipped to them. The concierge helped me print some FedEx labels and boarding passes, and the front desk was great. I ate at all three restaurants in the hotel (separate reviews coming) and they were all good.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay in a Friendly Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel sent a questionnaire to me after checkout asking about my stay. One of the sections was about the restaurants. There was one (Einstein Bagels) that I didn't rate as highly as others and I received an email from the manager who was concerned. As I wrote back to her, there was absolutely nothing wrong, but how could I rate a take-out bagel breakfast place the same as the excellent Compass restaurant at the top of the hotel where I enjoyed a great steak and bottle of wine with a wonderful view?
reviews.title: Not what you would expect from a Hyatt Regency.

reviews.text: As a result of this Hyatt I'll probably be choosing their brand more often.
reviews.title: Well run convention; downtown Phoenix

reviews.text: We checked into our room and from the start our family was disappointed. After we waited for someone to assist us we unloaded our vehicle ourself placing all our luggage on a cart then wheeling it to the front door. the bell boy who was watching us unload stopped us and said we were not allowed to use the cart and he would have to help us to our room. This is the same employee who watched us holding two young children while unloading. We got to our room which was dirty. Dust on the lamp shades dirty toilet and bathroom the carpet floors caused my one year old sons feet to become black from walking around barefoot in the room. I am disappointed with the Hyatt. I have stayed at others with a better experence. Asked for two queen beds got two full size beds. Ridiculous. Not family friendly.
reviews.title: Hotel stay and Compass Restaurant

reviews.text: We got a real cheap rate, as we were going to Arizona in August. We were in town to see the Diamondbacks, and the ballpark is in reasonable walking distance, even in the (dry) heat. The arena is also nearby.
reviews.title: Nice place; great weekend rate

reviews.text: The front desk was real helpful, and the doormen were helpful.
reviews.title: standard average
Medicore Hyatt Regency
reviews.text: There is nothing as far as food after midnight at the hotel or anywhere close to the hotel, whcih can be a bummer. The pool was nice, though it is not for swimming.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the cheapest Hyatts around but still delivers the standard-average dose of cookie-cutter, chain appointments and service. The only thing really distinctive about the property is the revolving restaurant, which though pricey for Phoenix does offer nice views of the sprawling accidental metropolis. The main annoyances were the nit-picky charges for valet parking and internet access, $19 and $12 respectively, and the disingenous notes posted in the room about various exorbitant convenience charges and the chain's purported "concern for the environment" as a motivation for not washing towels and bedding. Note: Navigating Downtown Phoenix is challenging currently due to ubiquitous construction for the new light-rail lines.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.disliked: — Lack of shops/restaurants in the area

reviews.text: This is the worst Hyatt Regency I have ever stayed at. The hotel rooms do not have the new "Hyatt Beds" and Egyptian towels. Our room looked like a throw back from the 80's. Bathroom was very small. Hotel needs renovation to get back to Regency standards.
reviews.title: Nice place with a staff that could use some training

reviews.text: Attended a business meeting in downtown Phoenix and stayed at Hyatt. Great location; easy walking distance to many attractions in downtown Phoenix. Short shuttle ride from Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport. Had a room on the 21st floor with great view of the city. Beds were heavenly and covered with light down comforter. The only negative is you have to pay $12.95 for a day for internet access. Would have thought this would be complimentary.
reviews.title: Great Downtown Location
Nice hotel...close to sporting events...but not much else
reviews.text: My cousin and I planned a spring '07 girls vacation to the Phoenix area. We got a great combo package that included staying here at the Hyatt. The hotel was nice and clean, friendly staff, and had a small but nice pool. The rooms were smaller and darker than we'd imagined, but not bad. Parking was a problem - they have a garage but you have to walk a bit. You might want to call ahead to make sure parking is available, as we had to deal with construction and finding OUR OWN PARKING for half of our stay. There is a cute/quaint outdoor shopping complex within walking distance - starbucks, pizza, subway, cute shops and a couple restaurants. We also walked to an Aveda Salon where we had a great time getting facials and manicures/pedicures. The girls there were very nice and personable. If you are coming to Phoenix for a professional sporting event, you can walk from the Hyatt. However, there's not much else around the hotel. We were disappointed to not be able to walk to restaurants or bars, or really even drive a short distance to any. If you are looking for more attractions - shopping, dining, nightlife, I'd recommend staying further out a bit. The weather was perfect the entire week. Scottsdale is a short drive away, and has several different style shopping/artsy areas with plenty of restaurants and entertainment. Sedona is a two hour drive but absolutely worth the trip! Another unique trait of downtown Phoenix was the helpful people who's job is to actually walk around the city looking to help people find their way! That was a welcome treat! Overall, our trip was very nice, and for the price (about $650 for air/hotel/rental car for a week pp), I would stay at the Hyatt again, and just have to drive a bit to find things to do.

Stayed here for two nights for a conference. It is located within a short walk to the USAirways Center ( Phoenix Suns basketball) and Chase Field ( Arizona Diamondbacks baseball) also near some of the Civic Center/auditoriums for concerts. Many good restautrants of all types within 2-3 blocks. When you go out in the day or night, you'll notice MANY City emplyees who are there to give directions and provide a feeling of safety. They, like the hotel staff, are also very friendly - a good experience, especially for the heart of a city. There is valet parking at the hotel ($16). I self-parked at a Visitor Center garage next door - $10/day with no in & out privileges. The hotel will "validate" for in & out privileges but that's another $6. Relatively small - but new and clean gym with fee weights and cross-trainers, treadmills and bikes - personal TV's and headphones. Conference rooms were spacious, well-lit, good sound. Function food was average.
reviews.title: Great Location - Safe downtown Area - Coffee Hi-jinx

likes.liked: — Location was convenient to many downtown Phoenix facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The funny thing was that I could not get a decent cup of coffee at this hotel. The housekeeping staff kept stocking me up with de-caf only; the function coffee just wasn't very good. And the Einstein's Bagels in the hotel had Vanilla Hazelnut in the dispenser labeled "French Roast". There is a Starbucks in the Civic Center across the street and I'm sure there are some good coffee places nearby.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and mine was quite large; and the Beds were A-plus comfy. I'd stay here again.
reviews.title: No thanks
Yuck......don't do it
reviews.text: You think Hyatt you think quality......not this time. The pool was so filthy that even the Mgr Sasha apologized for it. We were in Phoenix AZ durring August on a long weekend and were unable to use the pool because of its condition. Now thats bad....but not as bad as when we tried to sleep that night in our bed. Hard as a hardwood floor but even that wasn't as bad as the sheets...something out of a no-name Motel....they scratched you like they were made of sand paper. We spoke to the Mgr about all of this and to his credit he apologized and said the monies were not allowed at this time to up-grade the property....which really had NOT been looked after at all. We were supposed to stay thru Sun nite after arriving Thurs afternoon....we left Friday morning as fast as we could.

Was looking for a weekend getaway when we stumbled upon the Hyatt. They have a great package available in conjunction with the Diamondbacks. Staff was quick and friendly and property location was great. Room was clean and the food, it was great! Just a couple blocks from Chase Field. Downtown Phoenix has come a long way and is really cleaned up from previous visits. My family and I would not hesitate to stay there again, in fact we already have reservations to do so!
reviews.title: Great Service, Great Location
Worst Stay Of 2006 - Bummer
reviews.text: The people that work here are so nice...it's a shame that nothing else seems to work. I was put in a room that had no hot water, so then i switched to another room...upon returning home to that room later, the AC did not go below 73 degrees and my room had not been made up. So...they moved me to another room. At this point, i could live with the luke warm shower and another day when the building's AC went down (it's over 110 degrees in phoenix right now). Internet cut out for a few hours too. I paid $7 to pick up a package that was delivered to me ("handling fee"). Everything here is really nice to look at, it's just a huge bummer that i was thwarted at every turn. Very frustrating hotel to be stuck in for a week.

I received a great deal for a Friday night on Priceline. They fulfilled my room preferences. They brought up a toothbrush quickly upon my request. Everything was perfect. Unless you grew up on Sunnybrook Farm, the area is fine. Parking was $14 with in-and-out, but with the deal I received, I couldn't object. Convenient to the airport, sports venues and interstates. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Great Stay
Convenient location, not good service
reviews.text: I stayed for two nights because of a business convention. Rooms were OK, beds were not very comfortable. Also, as another reviewer mentioned, the doors of the TV cabinet don't open all the way, which makes for strange TV viewing. The view from the elevators was beautiful. Pool seemed fine; I didn't have time to try it.

We stayed at this Hyatt facility for two nights, namely December 10 and 11, 2005. Overall, we rated this hotel as a decent place to sleep; most guests would not find the facility attractive enough to do anything there except sleep at night and leave.
reviews.title: Just Okay/A Place to Sleep

reviews.text: The property is bland. There is nothing visually appealing about this hotel. It has floors, ceilings, walls, lights and a few pieces of bad art. The rooms are ordinary, basic, even simple. The bathrooms are very small. The hallways are dull and lifeless.
reviews.title: Funny angled TV

reviews.text: With one exception, the staff was not stimulating or even modestly attentive. We recall the neutral greeting when we approached the desk Saturday morning to check in. This young woman either was having a bad day or absolutely hated her job. The doormen were okay, mildly pleasant. We did not encounter any of the housekeepers. The most attentive person we encountered after two nights was the man at the desk when we checked out early Monday morning. He was focused, charming and engaging -- a major, and positive, departure from the other persons we met while at this hotel.
reviews.title: Good room, thin walls

reviews.text: We relied on the concierge to select a restaurant outside the hotel for dinner one night. He recommmended an Italian restaurant (we have forgotten the name, for reasons detailed below) located about ten minutes away by car. The food was very poor. The service was good. The facility had not been renovated since the 1970's. The recommendation was so poor that it made us wonder about the motivations of this hotel representative to recommend this place -- did he really dislike us that much, or did he have a personal interest in our visit?
reviews.title: great location for baseball
A Terrific Hotel
reviews.text: We had breakfast at the hotel one morning. The food was poor, in taste, quality and presentation. The service was okay. The buffet -- an option we did not select -- looked like the food items had been recycled recently. It was expensive, though.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night in Phoenix at the end of our roadtrip through Arizona. We purchased a king room at the Hyatt Regency on Hotwire for $66+fees per night. Probably a steal for this impressive hotel!
reviews.title: Good deal through Hotwire

reviews.text: Fortunately I thought to inquire about parking before we arrived, but the parking was still a bit of a hassle. You can valet park for over $20 with in and out privileges, or park yourself at a nearby garage (on the next block) for $10, or $16 with in and out privileges. In and out privileges at the garage are purchased through the front desk of the hotel and charged to your room. Does that make sense?
reviews.title: Elegant hotel - great location!

likes.liked: — Location, friendly staff and super clean property.

reviews.text: Our 5th floor room was really nice with a down comforter, a desk, a desk chair, an armchair, a table, a armoire with a cable TV, a coffeemaker, and a hairdryer. But unfortunately, it did not have a refrigerator, and interestingly, the TV was at an angle such that you could not watch from the bed. The room overlooked the pool/lounge area on the third floor.
reviews.title: What a regal hotel

likes.disliked: — Staff could have improved stay by sharing a little time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a very nice hotel, but it seemed to lack character after visiting other charming hotels and cabins across Arizona. Since we were staying only one night, we also didn’t have the opportunity to fully explore what the hotel and the neighboring area had to offer (although it’s right downtown, near a thriving nightlife area, and just blocks from the Diamondbacks stadium).
reviews.title: A very nice hotel

reviews.text: I enjoyed this hotel very much. The hotel employees were very friendly and helpful. It is located in downtown Phoenix within walking distance of restaurants and bars. The convention center is directly across the street. It is very clean and elegant. This is not your run-of-the-mill hotel. It is old-style with marble and soaring open spaces. The statuary and art is modern American-Western. There are doormen and bellhops. The revolving restaurant on the 24th floor reveals a panoramic view of the downtown Phoenix area, which is especially lovely at night. Do skip the valet parking for $23. You can park yourself for $10, and the parking garage is 1/2 block from the front door. I would gladly stay here again!
reviews.title: Nice Downtown Hyatt!!

likes.liked: — Location and close proximity of meal options

description: Experience the ultimate destination for business or pleasure in the city's dynamic downtown area. A towering 8-story atrium provides an inspiring atmosphere perfect for events of all types and sizes.
